title: Alcaraz rallies in French thriller: 'Just believed'
content: Carlos Alcaraz came back from two sets down and saved three match points to beat Jannik Sinner on Sunday and retain the French Open title.

title: Sources: RB Chubb expected to sign with Texans
content: Four-time Pro Bowl running back Nick Chubb is expected to sign a one-year deal with the Texans on Monday, sources told ESPN.

title: Sky's Vandersloot out for season with ACL tear
content: Veteran Sky point guard Courtney Vandersloot will miss the rest of the 2025 season after tearing her right ACL, the team announced Sunday.

title: Skenes pitches another gem, again without win
content: Paul Skenes pitched another gem but again walked away without a win. This time, the Pirates ace didn't mind as Pittsburgh was able to pull away.

title: Tearful Ronaldo says 'duty done' after 2nd NL win
content: Portugal skipper Cristiano Ronaldo shed tears of joy as they won their second Nations League title on Sunday, insisting that winning trophies with his country beats all club honors.

title: Lewandowski boycotting Poland after captain snub
content: Barcelona striker Robert Lewandowski has announced he will not play for the Poland national team for as long as coach Michał Probierz remains in charge.

title: Sources: Mavericks to work out Flagg on June 17
content: The Dallas Mavericks, owners of the No. 1 pick in the 2025 NBA draft, have scheduled a private visit for projected No. 1 pick Cooper Flagg on June 17, sources told ESPN.

title: MLS, players still at odds on CWC compensation
content: The discussions between MLS and the MLS Players Association over the Club World Cup prize money and player compensation remain ongoing, with the two sides failing to agree so far on terms in a newly revised section of the CBA.

title: 💰 $2.8B settlement lets colleges pay athletes
content: Schools are now free to begin paying their athletes directly, marking the dawn of a new era in college sports brought about by a multibillion-dollar legal settlement that was formally approved Friday.

title: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander's John Lennon shirt headlines NBA Finals Game 2 fits
content: The Indiana Pacers and Oklahoma City Thunder showed off the drip before Game 2 of the 2025 NBA Finals.

title: Portugal's impressive Nations League win over Spain outshines Ronaldo vs. Yamal
content: Ronaldo vs. Yamal was the story heading into Sunday's UEFA Nations League final, but Portugal's collective quality won the day -- and the headlines -- over Spain's impressive young talent.

title: Turkey loss gives Poch, USMNT more questions than answers
content: In its first pre-Gold Cup tuneup, the short-handed USMNT looked no closer to fixing its uninspired play.

title: USMNT sees positives despite 3rd straight loss
content: USMNT coach Mauricio Pochettino insists his players deserved better after falling 2-1 to Turkey on Saturday to suffer a third consecutive loss.

title: Pochettino dismisses Spurs links: 'Not realistic'
content: USMNT head coach Mauricio Pochettino shut down rumors linking him to the Tottenham Hotspur managerial vacancy, labeling the idea "not realistic."

title: Sacked Spalletti will still coach Italy on Monday
content: Luciano Spalletti has been sacked from his role as Italy's coach, the manager said Sunday, following their heavy loss against Norway.

title: Mbappe, Olise earn France third in Nations League
content: Goals from captain Kylian Mbappe and Michael Olise earned France a 2-0 victory over Germany in Stuttgart on Sunday, and a third place finish in this season's UEFA Nations League.

title: Santos say Neymar tested positive for COVID-19
content: Brazil forward Neymar has been sidelined after testing positive for COVID-19, his club Santos said in a statement as quoted by Brazilian media.

title: Sources: Ramsey set for shock move to Mexico
content: Former Arsenal and Juventus midfielder Aaron Ramsey is set to complete a shock transfer to Mexican side Pumas UNAM, sources have told ESPN.

title: Stanley Cup Final odds: Panthers favored to win series after Game 2 win
content: Top ways to bet the series and props for the Stanley Cup Final between the Florida Panthers and Edmonton Oilers.

title: 'That's the Thundor dream': How one superfan contributes to OKC's 'free throw defense'
content: Garrett Haviland, also known as "Thundor," is at the forefront of what fans in OKC call "free throw defense."

title: NCAA athlete pay: Here's what's next
content: Schools will begin directly paying their athletes in less than a month, thanks to a legal settlement that was officially approved in federal court Friday. However, the situation is far from settled.

title: Jennifer Kupcho ends nearly three-year LPGA winless drought
content: Jennifer Kupcho closed with an 8-foot birdie putt in light rain to hold off Ilhee Lee on Sunday in the ShopRite LPGA Classic, ending a drought of nearly three years without winning.

title: Joaquin Niemann takes LIV Golf Virginia for fourth win in 2025
content: Joaquin Niemann of Chile won LIV Golf Virginia on Sunday for his fourth victory in the Saudi-funded tour's first eight events of the season.

title: Let's match top NBA draft prospects to pro players: Our 14 best comps in the 2025 class
content: ESPN's Jeremy Woo shares high- and low-end comparisons for projected lottery picks, including Cooper Flagg.

title: Meet the QBs in the 2026 NFL draft class: Strengths, weaknesses for 22 intriguing prospects
content: Will Cade Klubnik, LaNorris Sellers or Drew Allar be QB1 in next year's draft? And who are the other names to know in the class?

title: Pro softball is on deck! What to know about the inaugural AUSL season
content: The league will feature four teams and a touring model that will serve as a "tryout" for prospective home cities next season.

title: Will USL's move to pro-rel change U.S. soccer, threaten MLS?
content: USL's introduction of promotion-relegation could change U.S. soccer forever, but it's still unclear how it will work.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United reignite interest in Barça's Ter Stegen
content: Manchester United are eyeing a move for goalkeeper Marc-André ter Stegen. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Can Man United resolve Sancho, Rashford, Antony, Garnacho transfer stress?
content: As Man United try to rebuild, getting the wrong players out matters as much as getting the right ones in.

title: 2025 Mountain West Conference preview: Can Boise State do it again?
content: The Broncos, the Group of 5 standard-bearer, reached the CFP. They might be MWC favorites, but others in the league made big moves.

title: Chaos at Money in the Bank: Highlights from John Cena's farewell tour
content: Here are the best moments from John Cena's "The Last Time is Now" farewell tour, which kicked off at Intuit Dome on Jan. 6.

title: LA clashes escalate amid Trump crackdown: Vehicles torched, dozens held; key points
content: President Trump deployed the National Guard to Los Angeles amid protests against deportation operations, sparking clashes and political backlash. Governor Newsom condemned the move as a breach of state sovereignty. Demonstrations intensified outside a detention center, with law enforcement using tear gas. Trump threatened further action, including deploying Marines, while Mexico defended migrants, heightening tensions between federal and state authorities.

title: IDF intercepts Greta Thunberg's yacht; group calls detention 'unlawful'
content: Israeli forces intercepted a civilian vessel, Madleen, carrying Greta Thunberg and other activists attempting to deliver aid to Gaza, defying the Israeli naval blockade. The Freedom Flotilla Coalition reports the ship was boarded in international waters, its crew detained, and aid confiscated.

title: B'luru stampede: Siddaramaiah blames police; denies govt role
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah distanced his government from the stampede deaths following an RCB victory celebration, blaming mismanagement by the police, KSCA, and RCB. He stated he was only informed of the incident nearly two hours after it occurred and had only approved the Vidhana Soudha event.

title: ‘Whole world now knows the truth’: Tharoor-led delegation wraps up US visit
content: A multi-party Indian delegation, led by Shashi Tharoor, concluded a US visit aimed at garnering international support for India's counter-terrorism efforts after the Pahalgam attack. The delegation met with US leaders, including Vice President JD Vance, who expressed support for India's response.

title: Economic terrorism as serious as cross-border terrorism: Naidu
content: Chief Minister N Chandrababu Naidu describes his first year back in office as challenging, citing economic setbacks and distrust from international partners due to the previous administration. Despite these hurdles, he aims for a 15% growth rate by leveraging technology and developing Amaravati into a Quantum Valley.

title: Tech jobs: Microsoft CEO's advice for Computer Science students; 'All of us..'
content: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella advises aspiring tech professionals to prioritize computational thinking fundamentals, even with AI's growing influence. He emphasizes the importance of logically breaking down problems and designing systematic solutions. Nadella also revealed that AI now contributes significantly to Microsoft's code, writing up to 30% of it.

title: French Open Final: Alcaraz saves 3 match points, outlasts Sinner to defend Roland-Garros crown
content: Carlos Alcaraz showcased remarkable resilience at the 2025 French Open, retaining his title against Jannik Sinner in a gruelling five-set final. Alcaraz overcame a two-set deficit and saved multiple match points to secure his fifth Grand Slam title. The epic battle, marked by exceptional skill and drama, will be remembered as a classic.

title: Delhi sizzles again: Mercury hits 42.1°C; heatwave alert out as temps may touch 45°C
content: Delhi's temperature soared to 42.1°C on Sunday, crossing 40°C after 17 days, prompting a 'yellow' heatwave alert for Monday and Tuesday with potential highs of 45°C. Similar scorching conditions are sweeping Haryana, Punjab, and Rajasthan, with temperatures exceeding 45°C in several areas. Relief is expected from June 13 with predicted rain and thunderstorms.

title: Four public sector banks cut lending rates after RBI move
content: Following the RBI's repo rate cut, public and private sector banks are adjusting lending rates. Existing borrowers with floating-rate loans are poised to benefit more due to automatic rate reductions. Banks are tweaking spreads on home loans and may lower fixed deposit returns to protect profitability, potentially impacting new borrowers and savers.

title: Tim Cook recalls Steve Jobs’ lesson: Says Jobs taught him to change mind quickly; Feels very thankful
content: Tim Cook credits Steve Jobs with teaching him the invaluable skill of rapidly changing his mind when presented with new evidence, a trait powered by emotional intelligence. Jobs's ability to shift direction and let go of pride influenced Cook and many others, including Jeff Bezos, Jony Ive, and Marc Benioff.

title: ‘Housefull 5’ box office collection: Akshay Kumar starrer inches towards Rs 90cr mark
content: ‘Housefull 5’ has premiered strongly, starring Akshay Kumar and others, accumulating Rs 87 crore in its first three days and is expected to cross Rs 100 crore by Monday. Akshay Kumar visited a cinema hall in disguise to gauge audience reactions, receiving positive feedback on the film's comedy and performances.

title: If strictly veg, why order from eatery that also serves non-veg: Consumer panel
content: A consumer commission dismissed a complaint by two Dadar residents who sought compensation after being served chicken momos at Wow Momos, despite claiming they ordered vegetarian. The commission questioned their choice of a restaurant with non-vegetarian options and noted the invoice indicated a non-vegetarian order. Furthermore, the residents failed to provide sufficient evidence to support their claims of religious disruption.

title: Falling fast: Shedeur Sanders picked behind Gabriel; Browns depth chart raises eyebrows
content: Shedeur Sanders faces challenges with the Cleveland Browns. Once a top prospect, he is now fourth-string quarterback. Critics question his commitment due to his off-field activities. Despite impressive college stats, he needs to prove himself. Joe Flacco is the current frontrunner. Sanders must show performance and patience to succeed. His journey from college star to NFL underdog is surprising.

title: Tesla Optimus chief resigns: Thanks Elon Musk in his farewell post on Twitter; says ‘You have …'
content: Milan Kovac, Tesla's Optimus robot project head, has resigned to spend more time with family abroad after nine years with the company. This transition occurs as Tesla intensifies its focus on autonomous technology and robotics. Ashok Elluswamy, currently leading Tesla’s Autopilot team, will assume Kovac’s responsibilities amidst challenges like rare-earth magnet export restrictions.

title: Formally write to us on Maharashtra 'rigging', EC babus dare Rahul Gandhi
content: Election Commission officials are challenging Rahul Gandhi to formalize his claims of "rigging" in the 2024 Maharashtra assembly elections by writing to the poll panel. The EC insists it can only offer a formal rebuttal to his "baseless allegations" if he communicates his grievances directly. The commission also expressed disappointment that Gandhi hasn't responded despite being invited for consultations.

title: From classroom to cosmos: Shubhanshu Shukla’s wife looks back & ahead
content: Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla's upcoming space mission aboard Axiom-4 marks a significant milestone for India. His wife, Kamna, shares her perspective on this journey, highlighting Shukla's dedication and courage. She fondly recalls his transition from a fighter pilot to a space explorer, emphasizing his problem-solving skills and unwavering spirit.

title: B'luru stampede: Families blame govt; ask who approved event; say cash won't heal loss
content: Families of the victims of the stampede outside Chinnaswamy Stadium are demanding answers regarding who authorized the victory celebrations that led to the tragedy. They question the need for the event, citing adequate celebrations the previous night, and criticize the lack of safety measures despite awareness of potential crowds.

title: Small towns boom: Tier-2 cities lead hiring surge; metros fall behind in talent race
content: Hiring in India's smaller cities is booming, outpacing metros with a 42% surge compared to 19%, reveals the Randstad Talent Insights Report 2025. BFSI, manufacturing, retail, and IT sectors are fueling this growth, establishing tier-2 cities as emerging talent hubs. Bengaluru leads tier-1 demand, while Chandigarh shines among tier-2 cities.

title: Manipur unrest: Curfew after Meitei leader's arrest; protests flare, internet shut down
content: Manipur is facing renewed unrest following the arrest of Arambai Tenggol leader, Kanan Singh, sparking violent protests in five valley districts. Authorities have imposed curfews, prohibitory orders, and suspended internet services to control the escalating tensions.

title: Packers-&-movers smuggle ganja worth Rs 27L with bank manager’s goods; 3 arrested
content: A packers-and-movers transporter, Avinash Dhoke, was arrested for concealing 108kg of marijuana within the household goods of a bank manager being transferred from Odisha to Nagpur. Kalamna police intercepted the consignment and arrested Dhoke and his associate, Palash Wankhede.

title: No need of slum-dwellers’ nod for Dharavi project, says CEO
content: Dharavi's redevelopment proceeds with over 50% resident consent, though not legally required due to government appointment of Nav Bharat Mega Developers, led by the Adani Group. A survey indicates 5 lakh eligible for free housing within Dharavi, while 5 lakh ineligible will be relocated to subsidized rental housing. Concerns arise over land allocation for rental units and free sale components.

title: After 13-year career, burglar’s home has gym, chandelier, bath tub
content: Amit Dutta, a 46-year-old man leading a double life, was apprehended by Howrah police for attempted burglary. For 13 years, he posed as a helpful neighbor by day and a thief by night. His lavish lifestyle, funded by stolen cash and jewelry, included a mansion with modern amenities and even a trip to Indonesia.

title: Andhra CM N Chandrababu Naidu pitches financial incentives to have more kids
content: Andhra Pradesh, facing declining fertility rates, plans to incentivize larger families, reversing its previous two-child policy for local elections. Chief Minister Naidu aims to boost population and invest in human capital by offering financial incentives to bigger families and removing restrictions on maternity leave. The state is also providing childcare support and financial assistance for schoolchildren.

title: In 2 years, NHAI barred 29 firms from bidding after poor quality work
content: PM Modi has directed the road transport ministry to establish clear standards for highway subcontractors and revise the selection criteria for supervision engineers due to concerns over poor quality work and damaged highways. NHAI has taken action against underperforming construction companies and consultancy firms, including penalties and debarment from bidding.

title: 'Active situation': Plane crashes in Tennessee with at least 16 onboard
content: A plane carrying between 16 and 20 people crashed in Coffee County, Tennessee, about 60 miles south of Nashville. Several passengers were airlifted to nearby hospitals, while others are being evaluated at the scene. Initial reports suggest the aircraft was being used for skydiving activities, according to law enforcement officials.

title: 6 more deaths tied to Covid take India toll since January to 65
content: India is witnessing a resurgence of COVID-19, with over 6,000 active cases and six deaths reported in the last 24 hours. Kerala, Gujarat, West Bengal, and Delhi are the most affected states. The Union health ministry is conducting mock drills and instructing states to ensure the availability of essential resources.

title: To expand defence manufacturing base, DRDO transfers tech on 9 systems
content: DRDO has transferred technology for nine land systems and weapon platforms to both defence PSUs and private companies, boosting indigenous defence production. This includes tech for mounted artillery guns to Bharat Forge and CBRN reconnaissance vehicles to BEL.

title: How talented actors can escape typecast trap: How stars decode casting cliches
content: In a film industry that thrives on formula and familiarity, typecasting is a chronic issue that plagues even the most gifted of actors. A romantic lead remains the romantic lead, the comic sidekick continues to crack jokes, and the villain lurks in every dark corner of the script—no matter how much potential lies beneath. But as cinema evolves, so does the desire for transformation. The real question is: How can actors break free from the shackles of typecasting and reclaim creative agency?

title: Day later, Goa CM Sawant intervenes, says GMC doctor won’t be suspended
content: Goa's Chief Minister Pramod Sawant overturned Health Minister Vishwajit Rane's order to suspend a Goa Medical College CMO after public outcry. Rane's directive followed a complaint about the doctor advising a patient to visit an urban health center for an injection. Sawant assured that the doctor would not be suspended, emphasizing the government's commitment to healthcare.

title: Inside Russia's India push: Putin eyes China-led bloc; what's in it for New Delhi?
content: Amidst US-Russia tensions over the Ukraine war, Moscow is actively seeking to strengthen its ties with India, particularly through defense deals and diplomatic initiatives.

title: Easy meat: How city businessman fell prey to scam, lost 1 crore to ‘exporter’
content: Delhi Police are investigating a fraud case where an NRI businessman was allegedly cheated of Rs 1.3 crore. The suspect, posing as a meat exporter, lured the victim with promises of high returns on investments. After receiving the funds in installments, the suspect disappeared, leading the victim to discover the fraudulent nature of the business deal.

title: Fearing Russian attack, Germany plans revamp of cold-war shelters & bunkers
content: Germany is preparing to expand its network of bunkers and shelters amid growing concerns that Russia could potentially attack a Nato country by 2029. The focus is on repurposing existing structures like tunnels and underground garages to quickly accommodate a million people.

title: 'Sever relations': US expert warns China planning ‘something worse than Covid’
content: Amidst arrests of alleged bioterrorists in Michigan, an expert advocates severing ties with China, citing potential threats worse than COVID-19. The case involves Chinese nationals accused of smuggling and researching a harmful fungus, raising concerns about espionage and potential economic disruption through agricultural sabotage. These incidents highlight ongoing security risks and the need for vigilance against foreign threats.

title: 'China is the enemy': Leaked Russian intelligence reveals deep-seated suspicions
content: A leaked FSB document exposes Russia's deep-seated distrust of China, viewing it as a significant espionage threat despite public displays of unity. The memo details alleged Chinese efforts to steal technology, recruit experts, and gather intelligence on military operations, particularly concerning the war in Ukraine and Arctic development.

title: 7 early symptoms of liver disease often ignored
content: The liver's vital role in detoxification and digestion is often overlooked until disease strikes. Early symptoms like fatigue, abdominal pain, jaundice, and itchy skin can be subtle indicators of liver dysfunction. Dark urine, unexplained weight loss, and changes in stool color also warrant attention, as prompt diagnosis is crucial for effective treatment and preventing further liver damage.

title: New front in Ukraine war? Russia breaches Dnipropetrovsk region
content: Russia claims its forces have advanced into Ukraine's Dnipropetrovsk region for the first time since the invasion began, a claim Ukraine denies. This reported escalation occurs amid stalled peace talks where Russia demands control over five Ukrainian regions, a condition Kyiv rejects. Despite the tensions, a prisoner exchange may occur next week, while Russia accuses Ukraine of refusing to reclaim dead soldiers' bodies.

title: Sidney Crosby’s low-key love: 16 years with Kathy Leutner; no wedding plans yet
content: NHL icon Sidney Crosby's stellar hockey career is complemented by his enduring, private relationship with Kathy Leutner. Dating since 2008 after meeting through mutual friends, Crosby and Leutner have maintained a low-profile romance amidst fame. Leutner, a former model for brands like Abercrombie & Fitch, supports Crosby from the sidelines, showcasing a bond that prioritizes substance over public attention.

title: 'I cannot defeat DMK but...': Shah challenges Stalin as BJP gears up for TN polls
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah, addressing a rally in Madurai, asserted that while Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin believes Shah cannot defeat the DMK, the people of Tamil Nadu will ensure the DMK's loss in the upcoming assembly elections. Shah expressed confidence in a BJP-AIADMK alliance victory.

title: Feud on pause? Aides of Musk, Trump hold talks; 'relations remains uncertain'
content: Aides are in talks to maintain the fragile peace between Donald Trump and Elon Musk, following their social media clash. Despite a temporary halt in public disagreements, tensions remain high, fueled by Musk's criticisms and Trump's anger over Epstein-related claims.

title: Unrest in LA: National Guard troops deployed on Trump's orders
content: Amid escalating protests against immigration raids in Los Angeles, President Trump deployed National Guard troops, a move Governor Newsom criticized as inflammatory and a misuse of power. The deployment, the first of its kind since 1965, sparked confrontations, with federal officers using tear gas.

title: PM Modi & Yunus exchange Eid greetings amid tense India-Bangladesh ties
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi extended Eid-al-Adha greetings to Bangladesh on behalf of India, as revealed in letters exchanged with interim leader Professor Muhammad Yunus. Yunus reciprocated, acknowledging the shared values between the nations. This exchange follows previous greetings for Eid-ul-Fitr and a meeting at the Bimstec Summit amidst tense relations since the change in Bangladesh's leadership.

title: Ahead of G7 Summit, focus on unchecked Khalistani extremism in Canada
content: A Canadian journalist has voiced serious concerns about the growing presence of Khalistani extremists in Canada. This alarming situation unfolds just before the G7 Summit, where Prime Minister Modi has been invited, despite ongoing tensions between India and Canada over the issue of extremism.

title: Charity jet sale? China's 50% discount for Pak sparks online backlash
content: A controversial plan to supply Pakistan with 30 J-35A stealth fighters at a discounted price has ignited criticism across Chinese social media. Citizens question the financial prudence and strategic wisdom of exporting an unproven, fifth-generation aircraft, especially given Pakistan's payment history and China's own needs. The deal raises concerns about subsidizing a client state with an unfinished product.

title: Watch: Engaged Rinku Singh stands still, Priya Saroj breaks floor with her moves
content: Cricketer Rinku Singh and MP Priya Saroj celebrated their wedding in Lucknow with a grand ceremony. A heartwarming video captured Priya dancing joyfully while a shy Rinku cheered her on. The event, attended by prominent figures from cricket and politics, followed an engagement ceremony and a visit to a temple for blessings, marking the start of their new journey.

title: Ex-PM Imran Khan to be released from jail? What his party leaders said
content: Imran Khan is anticipated to secure bail on June 11 in the Al-Qadir Trust case, according to PTI chief Gohar Ali Khan, while the Islamabad High Court is set to hear petitions for Khan and his wife. PTI plans a political movement led by Khan from jail and rejects any deals for his release, despite government offers for talks.

title: Assam flood situation improves marginally; 3 more deaths push toll to 26
content: No major river was flowing above the danger level in the State, with ferry services over the Brahmaputra resuming partially during the day

title: Congress leader Varsha Gaikwad stages protest against land transfer to Adani
content: Former Minister Varsha Gaikwad demanded to use the Mother Dairy land parcel for a botanical garden instead of a rehabilitation project

title: 75.67% candidates qualified APEAPCET-2025, says JNTU Kakinada VC
content: APEAPCET-2025 results are out; Probe in progress into the incidences of two mall practices, says Prof. Prasad

title: Flyovers won’t fix Hyderabad traffic, smarter road design can: Expert
content: “They [flyovers] are responses to induced demand, built primarily to accommodate the growing number of private vehicles,” urban transport expert Prashanth Kumar Bachu said

title: Private school managements threaten to withhold admissions until payment of pending fee reimbursement
content: They want the government to implement in letter and spirit Section 12 (1) (C) and Section 12 (2) of the Right of Children to Free and Compulsory Education Act

title: Spirit of mutual respect will guide India, Bangladesh to work for people's wellbeing: Yunus
content: Mr Yunus’s letter was a response to Mr Modi’s message conveying Eid-ul-Adha greetings to Bangladeshi people and the interim chief adviser

title: Andhra Pradesh Home Minister Anitha condemns remarks against Amaravati, asks Jagan and his wife to apologise to people
content: The comments made by journalists on the TV channel owned by the YSRCP chief and his wife are not only offensive to the people, especially women and farmers of Amaravati, but are also deeply disrespectful to the State, she says, and promises legal action against those involved

title: Vegetable market in Tirupati gets CCTV cameras after complaints of drug abuse in its vicinity
content: Police appeal to the public to dial ‘112’ to alert them about any anti-social activity happening in their vicinity

title: Visa agent arrested for human trafficking, cheating woman seeking work in Muscat
content: The accused was identified as Satyanarayana, a native of Skinnerapuram village in West Godavari district

title: Decoding the Kamal-Kannada episode
content: Democratic opposition to views can be voiced, but issuing violent threats or denying someone their right to live must be treated as punishable crimes

title: Season 3 of Tamil Nadu Cycling League cyclothon concludes
content: Rancycers clinched the first place, followed by Trichy Rockfort Riders in the second position, and Namma Chennai Riders securing the third position

title: Revanth Reddy releases Bandaru Dattatreya’s autobiography, calls him ‘Ajata Shatruvu’
content: The Chief Minister also pointed out that leaders, cutting across the political lines, admire Dattatreya whether or not he holds power

title: Will bring Sandeshkhali perpetrators to justice after BJP comes to power in W.B., says Suvendu
content: Sheikh Shahjahan, former Trinamool Congress leader from Sandeshkhali block in North 24 Parganas district, faces allegations of land grab and sexual assault by several women in the region

title: Aryanad police institute probe into marriage fraud
content: Ernakulam native Reshma is accused of duping at least ten men through marriage fraud over several years

title: Maharashtra, Karnataka account for 51% of FDI in India in FY25: Government
content: According to experts, the main reason for the maximum inflows in Maharashtra and Karnataka is substantial improvement in infrastructure

title: Swaraj’s friends, teachers rekindle his campus days magic
content: It provided a cherished opportunity for Mr. Swaraj’s friends and teachers to reconnect with him, reminiscing about old times and sharing laughter

title: Diet is both cause and cure for MASLD, a liver condition: experts at The Hindu-Naruvi event
content: MASLD is a lifestyle disease caused due to increased intake of food and decreased exercise; weight reduction is key to its management, say doctors

title: Age is only a number, says Ramadoss; hints at resolution of conflict with son
content: PMK founder navigates power struggle with son Anbumani Ramadoss, seeking control over party operations.

title: Protester in Bangladesh student uprising of 2024 is a voter in W.B.’s Kakdwip
content: Newton Das, whose photos of being involved in Bangladesh revolution is available in public domain, says that he is a voter of Kakdwip Assembly seat in W.B. since 2014. His relatives say he has voting rights in both the countries

title: Extremely fortunate to be part of space mission, says Indian astronaut Shukla ahead of June 10 launch
content: Mr. Shukla will be the second Indian to travel to space, 41 years after his idol Rakesh Sharma undertook a spaceflight in 1984 onboard erstwhile Soviet Union's Soyuz spacecraft for an eight-day stay in orbit

title: Why is BJP chief speaking on behalf of Election Commission, asks Congress
content: Congress MP Jairam Ramesh tells the Election Commission to “be independent and transparent” and asked not to speak through BJP president Nadda

title: Be careful with your words, Shiv Sena MLA Nilesh Rane tells brother and BJP Minister Nitesh Rane
content: Mr. Nilesh Rane asked Mr. Nitesh Rane “not to forget that we are in alliance” over his remarks that the BJP is at the top, as Prime Minister at the Centre and the Chief Minister at the State are from the BJP.

title: K.C. Venugopal calls up Rajagopal Reddy as Congress leaders sulk over denial of berths
content: TPCC president Mahesh Goud and Minister Ponnam Prabhakar met senior leader Malreddy Ranga Reddy, who was also miffed at being overlooked

title: A village’s cry to keep a panchayat union primary school running in Tiruvallur
content: Vellambakkam Panchayat Union Primary School was built 20 years ago. Residents of this village say they fought hard to get a school established and a road laid. The enrolment was down to one student last year. The number of students has gone up to three this year. Residents attribute the problem to the dwindling population and the parents’ preference for private schools

title: Chirag Paswan: From Parliament to Patna
content: Three-time Bihar MP Chirag Paswan has thrown open the decision on whether to contest the Assembly election later this year to his State’s electorate and to his party, the Lok Janshakti Party (Ram Vilas). Sobhana K. Nair and Amit Bhelari delve into how a man with a national outlook is making a space for himself in State politics

title: Bengaluru stampede: Siddaramaiah defends action against police, says government didn’t organise Vidhana Soudha felicitation event
content: Though the first death due to the stampede was reported at 3.50 p.m. on June 4, Siddaramaiah said he was informed about it only at 5.45 p.m. that day

title: One in a million: Chalavara quadruplets set to take first step into school
content: The toddlers are expected to turn heads and capture hearts as they embark on this new chapter in their young lives.

title: TIPRA Motha calls for protest on illegal foreigners’ issue
content: TIPRA Motha calls for protests to detect and deport illegal foreigners in Tripura, supported by BJP alliance

title: Police to examine bank statements in cases involving BJP leader Krishnakumar
content: Museum police are set to intensify their probe into the two cases involving BJP leader and actor G. Krishnakumar and his daughter Diya’s jewellery outlet

title: Heavy rain lashes Vellore and its neighbouring districts
content: Several low-lying areas, such as Sampath Nagar and Kansalpet in Old Town within the Vellore Corporation limits, were inundated due to the continuous rain. Frequent power cuts and crop damage were also reported

title: Cannot go against court orders to demolish slums, says Delhi CM
content: AAP to launch movement at Jantar Mantar on June 29 against slum demolition; party says displaced residents of Madrasi Camp have been allotted houses in faraway Narela

title: Three-day police custody for former Agriculture Minister Kakani Govardhan Reddy ends
content: Those involved in the scores of scams during the erstwhile YSR Congress Party regime will be punished, says Somireddy in a meeting in Melbourne

title: Padmanabhaswamy Temple performs rare 'Maha Kumbhabhishekam' after 270 years
content: This grand consecration took place following the recent completion of long-overdue renovation work at this ancient temple

title: Four persons of a gang arrested on charge of duping job seekers in Vizianagaram
content: The accused collected ₹53 lakh from the seven youth, say the police adding that main accused will also be arrested soon

title: Telangana Cabinet expansion | Who is Dharmapuri Adluri Laxman Kumar
content: Mr. Laxman Kumar began his political journey in 1982, serving as the NSUI president in Junior College Godavarikhani in erstwhile combined Karimnagar district

title: IAF airlifts kidney, cornea; multi-organ donation saves lives of five
content: According to the IAF, one kidney and a cornea were flown to the Army Hospital (Research & Referral) in Delhi

title: More Rhodes scholarships to Oxford University for Indians from 2028
content: ‘The priority now is to try to get some additional scholarships for places where the number of scholars per head of population could be higher, and India is one of those places,’ the Rhodes Scholarship Trust’s CEO said

title: RPSF personnel to be deployed for security duty in Tiruchi Railway Division
content: The move is to support the Railway Protection Force personnel of Tiruchi Division in view of manpower shortage

title: Assam Government slammed as trees slashed to make space for flyover in Guwahati
content: Civil society activists said the authorities made a U-turn from the commitment given to the Gauhati High Court six months ago, not to touch a single tree, some more than a century old

title: Five officers moved amid reports of rift within Pathanamthitta police
content: Sources indicate that transfers were prompted by suspicions that internal information regarding a case had been leaked to the media from Additional SP’s office

title: India will protect farmers' interest in U.S. trade talks: Shivraj Singh Chouhan
content: The Union Agriculture Minister’s comments come as India and the U.S. continue negotiations on expanding agricultural trade, with Washington seeking reduced tariffs and improved market access for its farm products in the Indian market

title: Visitors’ fee at Kozhikode MCH temporarily withdrawn
content: The fee was enforced in the wake of a direction from the Department of Health and Family Welfare to restrict the number of visitors to the facility in view of a rise in COVID cases

title: Police in search of kingpins behind suspected inter-district sex racket
content: According to the statements of the six rescued women, the prime suspects are reportedly operating similar rented facilities for sex trafficking in several other districts

title: Rape accused hiding in Sabarimala forests for a decade arrested
content: The accused, Appukuttan (39), a native of Manjathodu, was captured near the Tamil Nadu border at Aryankavu by a special investigation team from the Pampa police station

title: Kerala University secures patent for eco-friendly solar cell technology
content: The breakthrough came through a joint effort by the university’s Physics and Botany departments, under its Translational Research and Innovation Centre (TRIC-KU)

title: Anam Venkata Reddy left an indelible impression on Nellore’s political landscape, say speakers
content: Former Minister’s life-size bronze statue reinstalled at Ramalingapuram Circle during a function organised by Simhapuri Seva Samithi

title: Protests Intensify In Los Angeles After Trump Deploys National Guard Troops
content: Tensions in LA escalated Sunday as thousands of protesters took to the streets in response to Trump's deployment of the National Guard, blocking off a major freeway and setting autonomous vehicles on fire as local law enforcement used tear gas.

title: Bangladesh's Muhammad Yunus' "Mutual Respect" Letter To PM Modi
content: The spirit of mutual respect and understanding will continue to guide India and Bangladesh in working for people's welfare, Chief Adviser Muhammad Yunus has said in a letter to Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

title: Ceasefire-Linked Kuki Insurgent Among 3 Arrested By NIA For Allegedly Killing 2 Manipur Commandos
content: Three insurgents have been arrested by the National Investigation Agency (NIA) for allegedly attacking a police post and killing two commandos in Manipur's border town Moreh in January 2024.

title: "You Better Turn Back": Israel Warns Greta Thunberg On Gaza-Bound Yacht
content: Israeli Defence Minister Israel Katz told the military on Sunday to stop a charity boat carrying activists, including Sweden's Greta Thunberg, who are planning to defy an Israeli blockade and reach Gaza.

title: 'We Honour Daughters': Chandrababu Naidu Slams Offensive Remarks Against Amaravati Women
content: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister N Chandrababu Naidu and his deputy Pawan Kalyan on Sunday condemned derogatory remarks allegedly made by a couple of journalists against women of Amaravati.

title: "We Found Mohammed Sinwar Here": Israel Reveals Tunnel Under Gaza Hospital
content: The Israeli army said on Sunday it had retrieved the body of Hamas' military chief Mohammed Sinwar in an underground tunnel beneath a hospital in southern Gaza, following a targeted operation last month.

title: Ponywallahs Facing A Loss Of Rs 2 Crore A Day In Pahalgam
content: The wheels of economy have come to a grinding halt in Kashmir's Pahalgam, since 25 tourists and a local man were shot down by terrorists in the scenic Baisaran Valley.

title: IAS Officer Caught While Allegedly Accepting Bribe Of Rs 10 lakh In Odisha
content: The Odisha Vigilance Department on Sunday caught an IAS officer allegedly accepting a bribe of Rs 10 lakh from a businessman, an official release said.

title: "Realised Am Nothing For You": Model's Last Post Before Dying By Suicide
content: A model died by suicide in Gujarat's Surat on June 7. A day before Anjali Varmora was found hanging at her home, she posted a reel on her Instagram handle with a cryptic text: "Today I realised I am nothing for you".

title: Manipur Governor Reviews Security Amid Protests, Meets MLAs' Delegation
content: Manipur Governor Ajay Kumar Bhalla on Sunday held a security review meeting with senior officials in the wake of violent protests across the state.

title: Trump Deploys National Guard Over Los Angeles Immigration Protests
content: National Guard troops began arriving in Los Angeles early Sunday after being ordered there by US President Donald Trump, a rare deployment against the state governor's wishes after sometimes violent protests against immigration enforcement raids.

title: Viral Video Shows New Pope Apologising For Being "Little Late"
content: Addressing a gathering of Christian leaders at a landmark conference marking the 1,700th anniversary of the First Council of Nicaea, the Pope skipped the usual formalities and began with an apology.

title: US Man Gets Life In Prison For Breaking Spine Of 2-Year-Old, Killing Her
content: A Florida man has been sentenced to life in prison for the brutal killing of his ex-girlfriend's 2-year-old daughter.

title: Video: Andhra Minister Tosses Bouquet After Official Fails To Answer Query
content: Andhra Pradesh Minister S Savitha threw a bouquet behind her after a district tahsildar (revenue official) failed to answer her query about gas cylinder distribution, say sources, sparking criticism of the minister's high-handed approach.

title: Watchdog Agency Shuts Down Blinkit In Pune For Running Without Licence
content: The Food and Drug Administration of Maharashtra has taken major action against a dark store "Energy Darkstore Services" located in Balewadi-Baner area of Pune city.

title: UP Couple On Honeymoon Missing After Car Falls 1,000 Feet Into Sikkim River
content: A newly married couple from Uttar Pradesh's Pratapgarh district went to Sikkim for their honeymoon. 15 days on, they are yet to return home.

title: Mumbai Woman Loses Rs 99,000 After Rs 9 Payment To Fake Cleaning Service
content: A woman lost Rs 99,000 after she made a payment of Rs 9 to a fake online cleaning service. The shocking cyber fraud was reported from Mumbai's Andheri West.

title: Adani Group's Cement Business Contributes To 30% Of India's Homes: Ambuja Cement CEO
content: Adani Group firm Ambuja Cements -- the second largest cement producer in the country -- contributes to nearly 30 per cent of the cement used for India's homes and infrastructure, the company said in its latest annual report.

title: "In 2026, BJP Rule Is Certain In Tamil Nadu," Says Amit Shah. DMK Hits Back
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah, on a high-stakes visit to Tamil Nadu, delivered a fiery address in Madurai, asserting that the BJP-led alliance will form the government in the state after the 2026 Assembly elections.

title: 'He died the way he lived—underground': Israel recovers Sinwar's body from tunnel
content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . read More 8 ways to add Curd to your breakfast 10 local dishes to try in Mangalore Countries where Google is banned, blocked or restricted 9 most unique islands from across the world 8 easy ways to enjoy prawns at home 10 simple mind tricks to keep brain fog away 10 short books that will give the biggest lessons for 2025 8 types of mushroom and their benefits 10

title: To succeed at Western Kentucky, Tyson Helton seeks gunslingers
content: western Kentucky head coach Tyson Helton evaluates a quarterback . he says he wants a player completely unaffected by the moment . "there's not one damn great quarterback who don't walk up there like John Wayne," helton says .

title: The Big Two? This Alcaraz-Sinner rivalry is epic
content: Carlos Alcaraz beats Jannik Sinner 4-6, 6-7 (4), 6-4, 7-6 (3) . it was the second-longest major final in the era, the longest at Roland garros . the two men had won the french open for 20 years .

title: How the spoils will get divided from NCAA settlement
content: university of Alabama athletic director Greg Byrne has worked in college athletics for over three decades . he's seen it all, at least until late Friday night, when he began officially facing a new challenge . the settlement allows athletic departments to pay out about $20.5 million directly to their players .

title: With French Open title, Coco Gauff's time is now
content: coco Gauff wins first major win of the year at the french open . she outlasts Sabalenka to win 1st french open 10h Simon Cambers . a year removed from her junior title at the French Open . the 15-year-old has won a wta tour title .

title: Phillies plan for lineup without Harper
content: our fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around MLB . the week's finale features the Boston Red Sox visiting the new york Yankees in the ESPN Sunday night showcase . Julio Rodriguez left last night's game between the Seattle Mariners and los Angeles Angels after he was struck on the foot on a line drive hit by Randy Arozarena .

title: Denny Hamlin, awaiting son's birth, wins at Michigan
content: Denny Hamlin outlasted the competition at Michigan International Speedway for his third victory of the season . the 44-year-old was prepared to leave his team to join his fiancée, Jordan Fish, who is due to give birth to their third child, a boy .

title: GOAT debate revived? Dvalishvili taps out O'Malley
content: merab Dvalishvili beat Sean O'Malley to retain the men's bantamweight title . Kayla Harrison knocked off Julianna Pea to claim the women's championship . it's expected that Cory Sandhagen will challenge the new title-holder . MMA GOAT, Amanda Nunes, will return to face the winner of Harrison-Pea .
